general:
Usage: sudo [-a|--admin|-s|--system|-t|--ti] <application> [arguments...]
sudo -c <rule> <value>
sudo -h | -? | /? [command]

Privilege options:
  -a, --admin    Run as administrator
  -s, --system   Run as SYSTEM
  -t, --ti       Run as TrustedInstaller

Config options:
  -c <rule> <value>   Set config rule
  -c -h               Show config help
  -c <rule> -h        Show help for a config rule

Examples:
  sudo -s notepad.exe
  sudo -c default_privilege system
  sudo -c default_mode create_new_window
  sudo -h
  sudo -c -h
  sudo -c default_mode -h
c:
Config command usage:
  sudo -c <rule> <value>
  sudo -c -h
  sudo -c <rule> -h

Available rules:
  default_privilege: admin, system, ti
  default_mode: inline, create_new_window, input_disabled
default_privilege:
Rule: default_privilege
Sets the default privilege level for sudo.
Values: admin, system, ti
Example: sudo -c default_privilege system
default_mode:
Rule: default_mode
Sets the default launch mode for sudo.
Values: inline, create_new_window, input_disabled
Example: sudo -c default_mode create_new_window
